intro: Diplycosia lamii, commonly known as the slender leaf thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces a milky sap that contains various alkaloids, some of which have medicinal properties. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
